title: WCAS HISTORY 300-0-26 New Lectures in History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course looks at the three central questions of modern Mexican history: Why was there a major social revolution? How did that revolution mutate into a very successful authoritarian state? Moreover, how did Mexicans with profound experience of mass mobilization live with that authoritarianism, and with the extremely unequal economy it permitted? In debating these questions, the course will not just introduce students to modern Mexican social, cultural and political history, but also consider a more general problem: Why people rebel, and why they do not rebel.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Considered and systematic participation, Short Essays (6 pgs. each), Midterm, & Final Exam
